abstract: National copyright agencies, which charge fees to publishers, see the proposed deal as a threat to their income.
snippet: National copyright agencies, which charge fees to publishers, see the proposed deal as a threat to their income.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN  Opposition is mounting in Europe to a proposed class-action settlement giving Google the right to commercialize digital copies of millions of books.

headline.main: European Opposition Mounts Against Google’s Selling Digitized Books
headline.print_headline: European Opposition Mounts Against Google’s Selling Digitized Books

byline.original: By Kevin J. O'Brien and Eric Pfanner

abstract: Yahoo and Microsoft hope that by teaming up, they can tilt the balance of power away from Google. First, however, Yahoo and Microsoft have to convince regulators that their plan won’t hurt advertisers and consumers.
snippet: Yahoo and Microsoft hope that by teaming up, they can tilt the balance of power away from Google. First, however, Yahoo and Microsoft have to convince regulators that their plan won’t hurt advertisers and consumers.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo and Microsoft hope that by joining forces, they can tilt the balance of power in Internet search away from Google. First, however, Yahoo and Microsoft have to convince regulators that their plan won’t hurt online advertisers and consumers, The Associated Press writes.

headline.main: Will Antitrust Probe Keep Microsoft, Yahoo Apart?

abstract: RealNetworks has created an application that allows iPhone users to access its Rhapsody music service. Will Apple approve the app, which competes with its own music store?
snippet: RealNetworks has created an application that allows iPhone users to access its Rhapsody music service. Will Apple approve the app, which competes with its own music store?
lead_paragraph: On Friday, Apple explained to the government why it blocked the Google Voice application from the iPhone App store. Among other reasons, it cited privacy concerns and potential user confusion.

headline.main: Will Apple Approve Rhapsody’s Music Application?

abstract: Google says that YouTube, which it bought three years ago, will eventually reach profitability. The San Francisco Chronicle looks at what steps Google is taking to get there.
snippet: Google says that YouTube, which it bought three years ago, will eventually reach profitability. The San Francisco Chronicle looks at what steps Google is taking to get there.
lead_paragraph: Three years after agreeing to buy YouTube in a $1.65 billion stock deal, Google is getting asked one question increasingly often: When will the video-sharing site turn a profit?
